Package common

Class CommonActionsController

java.lang.Object
common.CommonActionsController
public class CommonActionsController extends Object
This class implements all the methods that every or a lot of different screens uses, like logout, pressing the X , Back, or Next button in the screen and use of a PopUp window. (The goal is to reduce the duplicate code in individuals screens). This class uses the tables: 'user' - for logout users when logout or X pressed

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    backOrNextPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String newPage)
    This method is called when the back button or a button that is used to transfer the user to another screen is pressed from on of the screens controllers and uses the changeScreen class to transfer to the wanted screen
    private void
    changeUserLoggedIn()
    This method is used to disconnect the current user from the database, reset all the needed controllers and their fields , and send request to the server to disconnect from the data base
    void
    hideCurrent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method hide the current screen (closes the screen before opening the new one)
    void
    logOutPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is called when logout is pressed in one of the screens controllers change the window to the login window and call the changeUserLoggedIn method to disconnect the logged in user from the database
    void
    popUp(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, String popUpTitle, String popUpMessage, String imagePath, String linkToString, javafx.event.ActionEvent eventToClose)
    This method uses the showPopUp method of class ChangeWindow to display a pop up window on screen, it also can transfer user to a new screen when pressing OK or X on the pop screen.
    void
    xPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is called when the X button is pressed in one of the screens controllers it uses the changeUserLogedIn method disconnect the logged in user from the database and notify the server that this client is disconnecting.

      private UserController userController

  • Constructor Details

    • CommonActionsController

      public CommonActionsController()

  • Method Details

    • logOutPressed

      public void logOutPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when logout is pressed in one of the screens controllers change the window to the login window and call the changeUserLoggedIn method to disconnect the logged in user from the database
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent click on the logout button

    • xPressed

      public void xPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the X button is pressed in one of the screens controllers it uses the changeUserLogedIn method disconnect the logged in user from the database and notify the server that this client is disconnecting.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent click on the X button

    • backOrNextPressed

      public void backOrNextPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String newPage)
      This method is called when the back button or a button that is used to transfer the user to another screen is pressed from on of the screens controllers and uses the changeScreen class to transfer to the wanted screen
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent click on the back or other button used to transfer to another screen
      newPage - the path to the FXML file (Screen) we want to transfer to

    • changeUserLoggedIn

      private void changeUserLoggedIn()
      This method is used to disconnect the current user from the database, reset all the needed controllers and their fields , and send request to the server to disconnect from the data base

    • hideCurrent

      public void hideCurrent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method hide the current screen (closes the screen before opening the new one)
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent click on the screen to be able to hide the screen

    • popUp

      public void popUp(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, String popUpTitle, String popUpMessage, String imagePath, String linkToString, javafx.event.ActionEvent eventToClose)
      This method uses the showPopUp method of class ChangeWindow to display a pop up window on screen, it also can transfer user to a new screen when pressing OK or X on the pop screen.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the stage for the new pop up screen
      popUpTitle - the title of the pop up screen
      popUpMessage - the message shown in the pop up screen
      imagePath - the image to show in the pop up screen (null if don't want to show image)
      linkToString - the FXML path to a new screen if the wanted action when pressed OK or X on pop up is to transfer user to a new screen (null if want to stay on same screen)
      eventToClose - the ActionEvent from the current screen to close it before transferring to a new screen (null if want to stay on same screen)
